instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
no liquid damage, suddnly no power on....there is green then orange, on SMC bypass fan on full power but nothing else.

ppbus_g3h - 12.50V
PP3V42_G3H - 3.3V 
PPVRTC_G3H - 3.3V
PP5V_S5 - 5.1v 
[B]PP5V_S3 - 5.1V
PP5V_S0 - 5.1V [/B]
SMC_LID - 3.4V 
PP3V3_S5 - 3.3V

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
So you get S3 and S0 voltages in normal mode?
That means board powers on; non function is different thing!
Or you only get 5V_S3/0???

Do not expext fan spins; only when CPU gets really hot.

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
Yes all voltage presents in normal mode just board with charger.
PP5V_S0 - 5v just after few seconds.
PP5V_S3 - i sew one's that it was jumping from 0v to 5v up and down...but now is stable. I was try to turn it on with ON/OFF from the board but nothing....i was waiting few minutes to see if the fan start but nothing.....wierd.

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message: i was connected now the board back to the body with all connectors...i was bypass SMC fan start (low speed) 3s on and off

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
Do you get stable VCORE?
Did you check for USB activity?

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
PPVCC_S0_CPU -0v short
no USB activity

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
Short for sure???
There is low value as normal.

Board stays on in normal mode?
If yes, post voltage on big coils, apart of CPU ones.

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
yes full short...015

"Board stays on in normal mode?" 
please explain

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
0.015 in diode mode means short in VCORE???

I didn't understand if board stays on, or goes off completely.
On is not the same as working board.
If you get S3 voltages, board is already on...

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
?????

Its stay ON...all s3 voltage are presents..

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message: Where should I look next?

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
Now check all S0 voltages.
In fact, look at pages 61/63.

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
Hi, I'm sorry to post here, but I can?t find how to make a new post, I'm a new user of the forum. So I have this same mother board 820-4924-A. It has no backlight, I have no voltage on enable pin on U7700.
EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN = 0 volts, no short to ground according to me.
EDP_BKLT_EN = 0 v
LCD_PSR_EN = 0 v
EDP_PANEL_PWR = 0 v
what can I try?
Thanks in advance!

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
Welcome to the forum!

Please read the note on top of the forum, about user and PayPal email account.
Write a meesage to forum staff, or directly to Louis, if still problems.
Mixing board issues in the same thread doesn't help...

Looks like missing image too.
So no reason to search for backlight yet.

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
PP3V3_S0 - 3.2v
PP1V05_S0 - 1.1v
PP5V_S0  - 5.1v
[U][B]P1V5S0_PGOOD - 0v no short[/B][/U]
P1V5S0_EN - 3.2v
P3V3S0_EN - 3.3v
PP3V3_S0_FET 3.2v
P1V05S0_EN - 3.3v
[U][B]PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT [/B][/U]playing from 12.2v to 0v maybe becouse screen is not connected?
[U][B]SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SCL - 0v
PP3V3_S0_EDP_SW - 0v (r5351)
PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT - 0v[/B][/U]
PP5V_S0_BKLT - 5.1v
PP5V_S0_BKLT_D - 5.1v
PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT_F - 12.5v
[U][B]PP1V5_S0 - 2.8v too high?[/B][/U]
P1V5_S0_FB - 1.5v
[U][B]P1V5_S0_FB - 2.6v too high?
P1V5S0SW_AUDIO_EN - 0v no short
PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO_HDA - 2.6v too high?[/B][/U]


i know there is few that no need but i put it anyway, did i forgut somthing?

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
1V5_S0 is really high at 2.8V.
For this reason its power good signal goes down.
Check R7880/81/82.
If all good, change U7870.

threads.title: 820-4924-a green/orange and dead...
threads.message:
R7880/81/82 o.k
change u7870 from other board....didnt work!
but the big news!!!!
i was look all the 1v5_s0 line and i was sew very small liquid on one of the cups near u6201...clean it and now its on....thanks!
